# Hooks
---
## What sucks in React?
---
* Sharing Behavior
* Classes are hard to optimize
* Components become unwieldy and split behavior across the file
---
export default LightLayout

### React needs a better primitive
https://reactjs.org/docs/hooks-reference.html
---

```jsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';

function Counter() {
  const [count, setCount] = useState(0);
  
  return (
    <div>
      Count is: { count }
      <button onClick={() => setCount((prevCount) => prevCount + 1)}>
        Increment
      </button>
    </div>
  );
}
```
<SimpleCounter />
---
<img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xT0GqtcVR0jOXzmmPK/giphy.gif"/>
---
### Hooks can be composed and shared
---
```jsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import useCounter from '../hooks/use-counter';

function Counter() {
  const { increment, count } = useCounter();
  
  return (
    <div>
      Count is: { count }
      <button onClick={increment}>Increment</button>
    </div>
  );
}
```
<SimpleCounter />
---
### How does this work?
---
```javascript
// Fake React Internals
const hooks = null;
export const useHook(stuff) {
  hooks.push(stuff)
}

function renderComponent(component) {
  // setup empty hooks
  hooks = [];
  // render component
  component();
  // see what hooks they registered and do stuff
  let hooksForThisInstance = hooks;
  // clear hooks
  hooks = null;
}
```
<Link dark href="https://twitter.com/jamiebuilds/status/1055538414538223616">Source</Link> 
---
export default LightLayout

### What does this mean for Weedmaps?
---
* Hooks work fine with SSR / Next.js
* Once production ready, we can use them
* Need at least React 16.7.0 (we have work to do)
---

### Hooks help co-locate behavior and make it portable
<video autoplay="true" loop="true" src="https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/DqsCilOU0AAoS7P.mp4"/>
---
#### HOC Replacement
```jsx
import React, { useContext } from 'react';
import { AuthStoreContext } from 'lib/stores/auth-store';
import { LocationStoreContext } from 'lib/stores/location-store';
import { BrandsStoreContext } from 'lib/stores/brands-store';
import useObserver from 'mythical-mobx-observer-hook';

function Counter() {
  useObserver();
  const authStore = useContext(AuthStoreContext);
  const locationStore = useContext(LocationStoreContext);
  const brandStore = useContext(BrandsStoreContext);
  
  return (
   // ... stuff
  );
}
```
---
### Avoids HOC Hell
<img src={require("file-loader!./hoc-hell.png")}/>
---
### What's my take?
---
<img src="data:image/png;base64," />
---
* I think classes are/were fine
* Hooks are compelling for performance and bundle size
* Could replace "stores" as abstractions for shared business logic
* We should be careful and fully understand the tradeoffs
